page.title: 18Local Opinion in Bridgerule
page.content: Many of the older residents were interviewed and asked several questions. The replies varied a little but the following are the more standard replies. Life in Bridgerule is friendly and all the residents are concerned for the welfare of each other. The church and chapel are focal points for community life as is the local primary school. There is a new small housing estate and now only one public house whereas before there were three. It has not changed a lot in appearance but socially there is more happening. There is also less industry. The growth of the village in terms of housing is a change for the better but the loss of industry is deemed detrimental to the lifestyle here.
